getNextId

private java.lang.Long getNextId(Protocol.user user)
IDs in Qantiqa are handled in a different way than Twitter due how hard is to get an unique ID inside the overlay. It can't be serial because that would involve some kind of global lock in the overlay, which is not possible. So, each use has an unique IDs space inside all possible values given Long.MAX_VALUE. IDs are partitioned by user and quark ID, using the first ten digits for user ID (enough to allow, in long term, every human on Earth to have an account in Qantiqa - it allows to handle 9.223.372.035 accounts) and the rest for quark (allowing by user to update one billion (US) / thousand million (EU) times). Example: 9 2 2 3 3 7 2 0 3 5|9 9 9 9 9 9 9 9 9 This last statement is based in research about the most tweeting accounts (even spam ones): http://www.techxav.com/2010/03/17/twitter-spam/ http://www.sysomos.com/insidetwitter/mostactiveusers#most-followers Based on the current use of Twitter, it should be enough with the proposed values. And the first ID ever will be 1.000.000.001.

Parameters:
user -
Returns:
